body.ab: <lb n="c56-0073__main__1"/><milestone spanTo="#c56-0073.05" unit="tei:head"/>Chap. 9<shi rend="sup"></shi><lb n="c56-0073__main__2"/> On my return I found the following letter <lb n="c56-0073__main__3"/> from my father. <lb n="c56-0073__main__4"/> To V.–Frankenstein <lb n="c56-0073__main__5"/> Geneva – June 2<shi rend="sup"> d</shi>– 17— <lb n="c56-0073__main__6"/> My dear Victor<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0073__main__7"/> You have probably waited impati<lb n="c56-0073__main__8"/>ently<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0073__main__d2e15520"/>the<del eID="c56-0073__main__d2e15520"/> for <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0073__main__d2e15525"/>the<del eID="c56-0073__main__d2e15525"/>a letter <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0073__main__d2e15533"/>which was<del eID="c56-0073__main__d2e15533"/> to fix <lb n="c56-0073__main__9"/><lb n="c56-0073__left_margin__1"/>the date of your return and I was at first tempted <lb n="c56-0073__main__10"/> to write a few lines <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0073__main__d2e15550"/>only<del eID="c56-0073__main__d2e15550"/><del rend="unmarked" sID="c56-0073__main__d2e15554"/>to<del eID="c56-0073__main__d2e15554"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0073__main__d2e15557"/>fix<del eID="c56-0073__main__d2e15557"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0073__main__d2e15560"/>that<del eID="c56-0073__main__d2e15560"/>merely mentioning the day<lb n="c56-0073__main__11"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0073__main__d2e15568"/>date<del eID="c56-0073__main__d2e15568"/><lb n="c56-0073__left_margin__1"/> on which <lb n="c56-0073__left_margin__2"/> I should <lb n="c56-0073__left_margin__3"/> expect you – but that would be <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>a<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0073__main__d2e15600"/>very<del eID="c56-0073__main__d2e15600"/> cruel <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>kindness<lb n="c56-0073__main__12"/> and I dare not do it. What would <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>be your <lb n="c56-0073__main__13"/> surprise <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0073__main__d2e15633"/>be<del eID="c56-0073__main__d2e15633"/>, my son<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0073__main__d2e15636"/>e<del eID="c56-0073__main__d2e15636"/>, when your ex<lb n="c56-0073__main__14"/>pected a happy and gay welcome to <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0073__main__d2e15646"/>heho<del eID="c56-0073__main__d2e15646"/><lb n="c56-0073__main__15"/> beh<mdel>o</mdel>eld on the contrary tears and wretched<lb n="c56-0073__main__16"/>ness. And how, Victor, can I relate our <lb n="c56-0073__main__17"/> misfortune<mdel/>? absence cannot have rendered <lb n="c56-0073__main__18"/> you callous to our joys and griefs and how <lb n="c56-0073__main__19"/> can I inflict pain on an absent child.? <lb n="c56-0073__main__20"/> I wish to prepare you for the woeful <lb n="c56-0073__main__21"/> news but I know it is impossible; even <lb n="c56-0073__main__22"/> now your eye skims over the page to <lb n="c56-0073__main__23"/> seek the words which are to convey to <lb n="c56-0073__main__24"/> you the horrible tidings.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0073__main__25"/> William is dead! That sweet child <lb n="c56-0073__main__26"/> whose smiles delighted & warmed me <lb n="c56-0073__main__27"/> who was so gentle yet so gay, Victor, he <lb n="c56-0073__main__28"/> is Murdered!<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0073__main__29"/> I will not attempt to <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0073__main__d2e15711"/>o<del eID="c56-0073__main__d2e15711"/> console you <lb n="c56-0073__main__30"/> but will simply relate the circumstances <lb n="c56-0073__main__31"/> of the transaction.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0074__main__1"/> Last thurday (May <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0074__main__d2e15731"/>26<del eID="c56-0074__main__d2e15731"/> 28<shi rend="underline">th</shi>) I; <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0074__main__d2e15739"/>yourmy<del eID="c56-0074__main__d2e15739"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0074__main__d2e15747"/>cousin<del eID="c56-0074__main__d2e15747"/><lb n="c56-0074__main__2"/> my niece and your two brothers went to <lb n="c56-0074__main__3"/> walk in Plainpalais. The evening was <lb n="c56-0074__main__4"/> warm and serene, and we prolonged our <lb n="c56-0074__main__5"/> walk <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0074__main__d2e15758"/>fat<del eID="c56-0074__main__d2e15758"/> farther than usual. It was <lb n="c56-0074__main__6"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0074__main__d2e15764"/><shi rend="underline">ale</shi><del eID="c56-0074__main__d2e15764"/> already dusk before we thought of <lb n="c56-0074__main__7"/> returning <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0074__main__d2e15774"/>When<del eID="c56-0074__main__d2e15774"/>and then we <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0074__main__d2e15783"/>found<del eID="c56-0074__main__d2e15783"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>discovered that Ernest <lb n="c56-0074__main__8"/> and William who had gone on before, <lb n="c56-0074__main__9"/> were not to be found. We accordingly <lb n="c56-0074__main__10"/> rested on a seat untill they should <lb n="c56-0074__main__11"/> return. Presently Ernest came <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0074__main__d2e15805"/>up<del eID="c56-0074__main__d2e15805"/>&<lb n="c56-0074__main__12"/> enquired for his brother he said that <lb n="c56-0074__main__13"/> he had been playing with <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0074__main__d2e15813"/>them<del eID="c56-0074__main__d2e15813"/> him <lb n="c56-0074__main__14"/> and that William had run away to <lb n="c56-0074__main__15"/> hide himself and that he had <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0074__main__d2e15822"/>wai<del eID="c56-0074__main__d2e15822"/>vainly<lb n="c56-0074__main__16"/> sought <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0074__main__d2e15831"/>fo<del eID="c56-0074__main__d2e15831"/> for him & afterwards wai <lb n="c56-0074__main__17"/> ted a long time but that he did <lb n="c56-0074__main__18"/> not return.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0074__main__19"/> This rather alarmed us and we <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0074__main__d2e15843"/>sought<del eID="c56-0074__main__d2e15843"/><lb n="c56-0074__main__20"/> continued to search for himuntill night fell<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0074__main__d2e15852"/>l<del eID="c56-0074__main__d2e15852"/>; <lb n="c56-0074__main__21"/><lb n="c56-0074__left_margin__1"/>when Elizabeth conjectured that he might have <lb n="c56-0074__main__22"/> returned to the house: <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0074__main__d2e15870"/>but<del eID="c56-0074__main__d2e15870"/> he was <lb n="c56-0074__main__23"/> not there – We returned again with torches <lb n="c56-0074__main__24"/> for I could not rest when I thought my <lb n="c56-0074__main__25"/> sweet child had lost himself, and <lb n="c56-0074__main__26"/> was exposed to all the damps & dews <lb n="c56-0074__main__27"/> of night; Elizabeth also suffered extreme <lb n="c56-0074__main__28"/> anguish. <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0074__main__d2e15886"/>We found him<del eID="c56-0074__main__d2e15886"/><mdel>a</mdel>About <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0074__main__d2e15900"/>four<del eID="c56-0074__main__d2e15900"/><lb n="c56-0074__left_margin__1"/>seven<lb n="c56-0074__main__29"/> in the morning I discovered my lovely <lb n="c56-0074__main__30"/> boy whom the night before I had seen<lb n="c56-0075__main__1"/> blooming & active in health stretch <lb n="c56-0075__main__2"/> ed on the grass livid and motionless– <lb n="c56-0075__main__3"/> the print of the murderers finger was <lb n="c56-0075__main__4"/> on his neck.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0075__main__5"/> He was conveyed home and the <lb n="c56-0075__main__6"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0075__main__d2e15941"/>extreme<del eID="c56-0075__main__d2e15941"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0075__main__d2e15944"/>wh<del eID="c56-0075__main__d2e15944"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0075__main__d2e15949"/>misery<del eID="c56-0075__main__d2e15949"/>anguish<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0075__main__d2e15956"/>agony<del eID="c56-0075__main__d2e15956"/> that was <lb n="c56-0075__main__7"/> visible in my countenance revealed <lb n="c56-0075__main__8"/> the secret to Elizabeth. She was extreme<lb n="c56-0075__main__9"/>ly<lb n="c56-0075__left_margin__1"/>very earnest to see the corpse. <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0075__main__d2e15987"/>which<del eID="c56-0075__main__d2e15987"/>^<mdel/>for a <lb n="c56-0075__main__10"/> long time<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0075__main__d2e16009"/>refused<del eID="c56-0075__main__d2e16009"/><lb n="c56-0075__left_margin__1"/>At first I attempted to prevent her but <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0075__main__d2e16028"/><del eID="c56-0075__main__d2e16028"/> she persisted, <lb n="c56-0075__main__11"/> and entering the room where it lay <lb n="c56-0075__main__12"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0075__main__d2e16037"/>quickly<del eID="c56-0075__main__d2e16037"/> hastily examined the neck of <lb n="c56-0075__main__13"/> the victim and clasping her <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0075__main__d2e16043"/>hads<del eID="c56-0075__main__d2e16043"/><lb n="c56-0075__main__14"/> hands exclaimed— <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0075__main__d2e16048"/>Go<del eID="c56-0075__main__d2e16048"/> Oh God! I have <lb n="c56-0075__main__15"/> murdered <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0075__main__d2e16053"/>this sweet<del eID="c56-0075__main__d2e16053"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0075__main__d2e16057"/>babe<del eID="c56-0075__main__d2e16057"/><del rend="unmarked" sID="c56-0075__main__d2e16060"/>.<del eID="c56-0075__main__d2e16060"/> my darling <lb n="c56-0075__main__16"/> infant.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0075__main__17"/> She fainted and was retored with <lb n="c56-0075__main__18"/> extreme difficulty; <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0075__main__d2e16072"/>and<del eID="c56-0075__main__d2e16072"/> when she again <lb n="c56-0075__main__19"/> lived it was only to weep and sigh– <lb n="c56-0075__main__20"/> She told me that that same evening <lb n="c56-0075__main__21"/> William had teazed her to let him <lb n="c56-0075__main__22"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0075__main__d2e16083"/>we<del eID="c56-0075__main__d2e16083"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0075__main__d2e16087"/>we<del eID="c56-0075__main__d2e16087"/> wear a very valuable miniature <lb n="c56-0075__main__23"/> she possessed of your Mother. This <lb n="c56-0075__main__24"/> picture is gone and was doubtless <lb n="c56-0075__main__25"/> the temptation which urged the mur<lb n="c56-0075__main__26"/>derer to the deed. We have no trace <lb n="c56-0075__main__27"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0075__main__d2e16105"/>of<del eID="c56-0075__main__d2e16105"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0075__main__d2e16108"/>Come my dear Victor<del eID="c56-0075__main__d2e16108"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0075__main__d2e16111"/>him<del eID="c56-0075__main__d2e16111"/> at <lb n="c56-0075__main__28"/> present of him, <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0075__main__d2e16119"/>but<del eID="c56-0075__main__d2e16119"/>altho our exertions <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0075__main__d2e16128"/>are<del eID="c56-0075__main__d2e16128"/>to discover him<lb n="c56-0075__main__29"/> are unremitted; but they will not restore <lb n="c56-0075__main__30"/> my beloved William.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0075__main__31"/> Come, dearest Victor, you alone can<lb n="c56-0076__main__1"/> console Elizabeth, <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0076__main__d2e16155"/>who<del eID="c56-0076__main__d2e16155"/>She weeps <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>continually& accuses herself <lb n="c56-0076__main__2"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0076__main__d2e16176"/>of all how u<del eID="c56-0076__main__d2e16176"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0076__main__d2e16180"/>so<del eID="c56-0076__main__d2e16180"/> unjustly <metamark function="displacement" xml:id="c56-0076.01">^</metamark><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0076__main__d2e16191"/>and<del eID="c56-0076__main__d2e16191"/> yet her words <lb n="c56-0076__main__3"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0076__main__d2e16199"/>of th<del eID="c56-0076__main__d2e16199"/> as the cause of his death—<lb n="c56-0076__main__4"/> pierce my heart. We are all unhappy <lb n="c56-0076__main__5"/> but <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0076__main__d2e16208"/>that<del eID="c56-0076__main__d2e16208"/> will not that be an additio<lb n="c56-0076__main__6"/>nal motive <mdel>to</mdel>for you, my <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0076__main__d2e16226"/>co<del eID="c56-0076__main__d2e16226"/> son, to <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0076__main__d2e16232"/>come<del eID="c56-0076__main__d2e16232"/>return<lb n="c56-0076__main__7"/> and be our comforter. Your dear Mother! <lb n="c56-0076__main__8"/> Alas, Victor! I now say Thank God she did <lb n="c56-0076__main__9"/> not live to witness <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0076__main__d2e16245"/>this grief<del eID="c56-0076__main__d2e16245"/><del rend="unmarked" sID="c56-0076__main__d2e16248"/>–<del eID="c56-0076__main__d2e16248"/><mdel>T</mdel>the cruel <lb n="c56-0076__main__10"/> miserable death of her youngest darling.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0076__main__11"/> Come, Victor; not brooding <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0076__main__d2e16267"/>w<del eID="c56-0076__main__d2e16267"/> thoughts <lb n="c56-0076__main__12"/> of vengeance against the assassin but <lb n="c56-0076__main__13"/> with feelings of peace and gentleness <lb n="c56-0076__main__14"/> that will heal instead of festering the <lb n="c56-0076__main__15"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0076__main__d2e16279"/>woul<del eID="c56-0076__main__d2e16279"/> wound<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0076__main__d2e16282"/>s<del eID="c56-0076__main__d2e16282"/> of our <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0076__main__d2e16285"/>soul<del eID="c56-0076__main__d2e16285"/> minds. Enter <lb n="c56-0076__main__16"/> the house of mourning, my son & friend <lb n="c56-0076__main__17"/> but with kindness and affection <lb n="c56-0076__main__18"/> for those who love you & not with <lb n="c56-0076__main__19"/> hat<mdel>e</mdel>red for your enemies. <lb n="c56-0076__main__20"/> Your affectionate & afflicted father <lb n="c56-0076__main__21"/> Alphonse Frankenstein <lb n="c56-0076__main__22"/><del rend="smear" sID="c56-0076__main__d2e16313"/>Al<del eID="c56-0076__main__d2e16313"/><lb n="c56-0076__main__23"/><metamark function="separate">_______________</metamark><milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0076__main__24"/> Clerval who had watched my countenance <lb n="c56-0076__main__25"/> as I read this letter was surprised in observ- <lb n="c56-0076__main__26"/> ing the despair that succeeded to the joy <lb n="c56-0076__main__27"/> I expressed on receiving news from my friends. <lb n="c56-0076__main__28"/> I threw the letter on the table and covered <lb n="c56-0076__main__29"/> my face with my hands.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0076__main__30"/> "My dear Frankenstien," exclaimed <lb n="c56-0076__main__31"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0076__main__d2e16346"/>hen<del eID="c56-0076__main__d2e16346"/> Henry when he saw me weep with<lb n="c56-0077__main__1"/> bitterness "are you always to be unhappy? <lb n="c56-0077__main__2"/> "my dear friend, what has happened?"<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0077__main__3"/> I motioned to him to <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0077__main__d2e16368"/>read<del eID="c56-0077__main__d2e16368"/>take up the letter <lb n="c56-0077__main__4"/> while I walked up & down the room <lb n="c56-0077__main__5"/> in the most extreme agitation. Clerval <lb n="c56-0077__main__6"/> read the letter – <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0077__main__d2e16386"/>and<del eID="c56-0077__main__d2e16386"/> tears also <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0077__main__d2e16390"/>gush<del eID="c56-0077__main__d2e16390"/><lb n="c56-0077__main__7"/> gushed <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>also from <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0077__main__d2e16409"/>his<del eID="c56-0077__main__d2e16409"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>the eyes <metamark function="displacement" xml:id="c56-0077.02">X</metamark><lb n="c56-0077__left_margin__1"/><metamark function="displacement">X</metamark>of Clerval <lb n="c56-0077__left_margin__2"/> as he read the <lb n="c56-0077__left_margin__3"/> account of my <lb n="c56-0077__left_margin__4"/> misfortune –"I can offer you <lb n="c56-0077__main__8"/> "no consolation, my friend," said he <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0077__main__d2e16450"/>my<del eID="c56-0077__main__d2e16450"/><lb n="c56-0077__main__9"/> "your <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0077__main__d2e16457"/>misfortune<del eID="c56-0077__main__d2e16457"/>disaster is irreperable.<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0077__main__d2e16464"/>"<del eID="c56-0077__main__d2e16464"/> What <lb n="c56-0077__main__10"/> "do you intend to do"?<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0077__main__11"/> "To go instantly to Geneva<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0077__main__d2e16474"/>"<del eID="c56-0077__main__d2e16474"/> come <lb n="c56-0077__main__12"/> with me, Clerval, to order the horses"<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0077__main__13"/> During our walk <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0077__main__d2e16483"/>C<del eID="c56-0077__main__d2e16483"/> Henryendeav<lb n="c56-0077__main__14"/>oured to raise my spirits– He did not <lb n="c56-0077__main__15"/> do this by the common topics of <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0077__main__d2e16495"/>conversatio<del eID="c56-0077__main__d2e16495"/><lb n="c56-0077__main__16"/> consolation but<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0077__main__d2e16501"/>t<del eID="c56-0077__main__d2e16501"/> by shew<mdel>e</mdel>ing the truest <lb n="c56-0077__main__17"/> sympathy. "Poor William" said "that dear <lb n="c56-0077__main__18"/> "child he now sleeps with his angel <lb n="c56-0077__main__19"/> "mother. His friends mourn and weep but <lb n="c56-0077__main__20"/> "he is at rest he does not now feel the <lb n="c56-0077__main__21"/> "murderers grasp – a <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0077__main__d2e16524"/>green<del eID="c56-0077__main__d2e16524"/> sod covers his <lb n="c56-0077__main__22"/> "gentle form and he knows no pain–He <lb n="c56-0077__main__23"/> "can no longer be a subject for pity his <lb n="c56-0077__main__24"/> "survivors are the greatest sufferers and <lb n="c56-0077__main__25"/> "for them time is the<del rend="vertical_line" sID="c56-0077__main__d2e16536"/>ir<del eID="c56-0077__main__d2e16536"/> only consolation. <lb n="c56-0077__main__26"/> "Those maxims of the stoics that death <lb n="c56-0077__main__27"/> "was no evil and that the mind of man <lb n="c56-0077__main__28"/> "ought to be superior to <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0077__main__d2e16548"/>that<del eID="c56-0077__main__d2e16548"/> despair <lb n="c56-0077__main__29"/> "on the eternal absence of a beloved <lb n="c56-0077__main__30"/> "object ought not to be urged – even <lb n="c56-0077__main__31"/> "Cato wept over the dead body of his <lb n="c56-0077__main__32"/> "brother."<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0078__main__1"/> Clerval spoke this as we huried <lb n="c56-0078__main__2"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0078__main__d2e16574"/>thou<del eID="c56-0078__main__d2e16574"/> through the streets the words <lb n="c56-0078__main__3"/> impressed themselves on my <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0078__main__d2e16580"/>memor<del eID="c56-0078__main__d2e16580"/><lb n="c56-0078__main__4"/> mind and I remembered them afterwads <lb n="c56-0078__main__5"/> in solitude. <del OurMisfortune is <lb n="c56-0090__main__26"/> doubly hard to us. <mdel>I</mdel>We have not only lost <lb n="c56-0090__main__27"/> that lovely darling boy but this poor girl <lb n="c56-0090__main__28"/> whom I sincerely love, is to be torn<lb n="c56-0091__Pt1__main__1"/> away by even a worse fate – Alas if she <lb n="c56-0091__Pt1__main__2"/> is condemned I shall never know joy more <lb n="c56-0091__Pt1__main__3"/> But she will not I am sure she will <lb n="c56-0091__Pt1__main__4"/> not and then I shall be happy again even <lb n="c56-0091__Pt1__main__5"/> after the <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0091__Pt1__main__d2e19770"/>d<del eID="c56-0091__Pt1__main__d2e19770"/> sad death of my little William."<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0091__Pt1__main__6"/> "She is innocent, my Elizabeth," said I and <lb n="c56-0091__Pt1__main__7"/> that shall be proved – fear nothing but let <lb n="c56-0091__Pt1__main__8"/> your spirits be cheered by the assurance <lb n="c56-0091__Pt1__main__9"/> of her aquittal.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0091__Pt1__main__10"/> "How kind your are," replied Elizabeth, <lb n="c56-0091__Pt1__main__11"/> "every one else believes in her guilt, and <lb n="c56-0091__Pt1__main__12"/> that made me wretched for I would as <lb n="c56-0091__Pt1__main__13"/> surely believe in my for I knew it to <lb n="c56-0091__Pt1__main__14"/> bethat it was impossible, and to see every one else <lb n="c56-0091__Pt1__main__15"/> prejudiced in so deadly a manner rendered <lb n="c56-0091__Pt1__main__16"/> me hopeless and despairing."
